full_summary:
### Air Charter Services - Community Consultations
### Services d'affrètement aérien - Consultations communautaires

#### Tender Reference: cb-53-46286136
#### Actualité Des modification: 3
#### Numéro de sollicitation: 5P420-23-0287/A
#### Date de publication: 2024-01-31
#### Date limite de soumission: 2024-02-14T16:00:00

Parks Canada invites qualified airlines to submit a proposal for air charter services to support in-person consultations on the Tallurutiup Imanga Interim Management Plan in the community of Clyde River, Arctic Bay, Pond Inlet, Resolute Bay, and Grise Fiord.

#### Contract Period: date of contract to May 3, 2024 (inclusive)

A flexible air charter service is required to transport up to 8 people to and from each location over a period of two consecutive weeks, returning to Iqaluit for the weekend. The trip involves spending approximately two days in each community.

#### Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement: This procurement is subject to the Nunavut Agreement.

#### Inuit Benefits Plan (IBP): Bidders must submit an Inuit Benefits Plan describing how they will integrate Inuit employment, ownership, and location in the Nunavut Settlement Area.

#### Evaluation Criteria: Selection will be based on lowest price, with consideration given to the Inuit Benefits Criteria and Nunavut Benefits Criteria.

Bid submission instructions:
* Bids will only be accepted via email or fax.
* Bidders must submit their bid to soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca.
* Attachments must be sent as email attachments, not via links.
* The maximum file size that Parks Canada can receive is 15 megabytes.

Late submissions, in-person submissions, and submissions by courier will not be accepted. Additional information can be found in the solicitation package. Bidders who elect to base their bids on documents obtained from other sources do so at their own risk.

This procurement is limited for bidding among firms registered on the Inuit Firm Registry (IFR).

Contact Information:
* Daniel Soucy, daniel.soucy@pc.gc.ca, (343) 574-2676
* Fax: 1-866-246-6893
* Address: 220 4 Avenue Southeast, Calgary, Alberta, Canada

### Important Notice:
The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
